div.p: Is fn 1 correct? It seems to me that this text is much more likely to be the address written by the person who wrote the MS, Is it in addition to the same information gven at the bottom of the letter
From James Wilson to James Agnew
RSA/B.13(9), Royal Society of Tasmania Archives, University of Tasmania Library, Hobart.
MS annotated on bottom left corner of first page: 'J. W. Agnew Esqre M. D. Secretary Royal Society' Colonial Secretary's Office

I have the honor to forward Copy of a letter received from Baron Von Mueller of Melbourne announcing the transmission by the Steam Ship Southern Cross of a shipment of Industrial Plants which he considers well suited for the climate of this Colony.

The Baron suggests that they should be tried in Tasman's Peninsula, in the meantime, I shall be glad that they should be received at the Royal Society's Gardens, when their ultimate destination can be considered and decided upon.
For list of plants, see B. Solly to J. Agnew, 29 July 1870.
